intro: Setaria setosa var. paractaenoides, commonly known as slender finger grass, is a variant of the panic grass genus native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often hairy along the edges. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with short, bristly bracts. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
